{{Cuban Revolution}} The '''Cuban Revolution''' was the overthrow of [[Fulgencio Batista|Fulgencio Batista’s]] regime by the [[26th of July Movement]] and the establishment of a new [[Cuba]]n government led by [[Fidel Castro]] in 1959. It began with the assault on the [[Moncada Barracks]] on 26 July 1953 and ended on 1 January 1959, when Batista was driven from the country and the cities [[Santa Clara, Cuba|Santa Clara]] and [[Santiago de Cuba]] were seized by rebels, led by [[Che Guevara]] and Fidel Castro's surrogates [[Raúl Castro]] and [[Huber Matos]], respectively .
== Timeline ==
=== Before the Revolution ===
==== 1898 ==== * The United States takes control of Cuba after Spain was defeated in the Spanish–American War and cedes all claims to the island.
==== 1902 ==== * Cuba declares independence although the country remains a US protectorate.
==== 1905–1929 ==== * US companies bought millions of dollars worth of Cuban land. * The US military intervened several times to put down coups, uprisings and facilitate elections. * The [[Communist Party of Cuba|Cuban Communist Party]] was established. * Following the stock market crash, the price of sugar, a main export, falls. Economic strife fuels revolutionary fervor.
==== 1933 ==== * A revolutionary junta led by military officer [[Fulgencio Batista]] seizes control of Cuba.
==== 1934 ==== * The US ambassador to Cuba reports that the new government is very unpopular "with all the better classes" and supported by the military only.
==== 1942 ==== * The Cuban Communist Party was legalized.
==== 1944 ==== * Batista steps down and a civilian government takes control.
==== 1945 ==== * Cuba joins the [[United Nations]].
==== 1953 ==== *'''26 July''' – Castro leads a ragtag group of 160 rebels in an attack against the [[Moncada barracks]] in [[Santiago de Cuba]]. *'''16 October''' – Fidel Castro makes "[[History Will Absolve Me]]" speech in his own defense against the charges brought on him after the attack on the Moncada Barracks.
===1954===
*1954 ''September'' Che Guevara arrives in Mexico City. *1954 ''November'' Batista dissolves parliament and is elected constitutional president without opposition. ===1955===
*1955 ''May'' Fidel and surviving members of his movement are released from prison under an amnesty from Batista. *1955 ''June'' Brothers [[Fidel Castro|Fidel]] and [[Raúl Castro]] are introduced to Che Guevara in Mexico City.
===1956===
*1956 ''Nov 25'' Fidel Castro, with some 80 insurgents including Raúl Castro, Che Guevara and [[Camilo Cienfuegos]] set sail from Mexico for Cuba on the yacht [[Granma (yacht)|Granma]]. *1956 ''December 2'' Granma lands in [[Oriente Province]].
==1957==
*1957 ''January 17'', Castro's guerrillas score their first success by sacking an army outpost on the south coast, and started gaining followers in both Cuba and abroad. *1957 ''March 13'', University students mount an unsuccessful attack on the Presidential Palace in Havana. *1957 ''May 28'', Castro's 26 July movement overwhelm an army post in [[Uvero|El Uvero]]. *1957 ''July 30'' Cuban revolutionary [[Frank País]] is killed in the streets of [[Santiago de Cuba]] by police while campaigning for the overthrow of Batista government
==1958==
*1958 ''February'' Raúl Castro opens a front in the Sierra de Cristal on Oriente's north coast. *1958 ''March 13'' U.S. suspends shipments of arms to Batista's forces. *1958 ''March 17'' Castro calls for a general revolt. *1958 ''April 9'' A general strike, organized by the 26th of July movement, is partially observed. *1958 ''May'' Batista sends an army of 10,000 into the [[Sierra Maestra]] to destroy Castro's 300 armed guerrillas. By August, the rebels had defeated the army's advance and captured a huge amount of arms. *1958 ''November 1'' A Cuban aircraft en route from Miami to Havana is hijacked by militants but crashes. The hijackers were trying to land at Sierra Cristal in Eastern Cuba to deliver weapons to [[Raúl Castro]]'s rebels. It is the first of what was to become many [[List of Cuba-US aircraft hijackings|Cuba-U.S. hijackings]] *1958 ''December'' Guevara directs a rebel attack on [[Santa Clara, Cuba|Santa Clara]] *1958 ''December 28'' Guevara's guerrilla troops seize Santa Clara. *1958 ''December 31'' [[Camilo Cienfuegos]] leads revolutionary guerrillas to victory in [[Yaguajay]].
==References== [http://www.aljazeera.com/focus/2009/07/2009726104942190404.html Cuba: Timeline of a revolution] by [[Al Jazeera English]] [[Category:Timelines of military conflicts since 1945|Cuban revolution]] [[Category:Cuban Revolution]]

{{Use dmy dates|date=October 2015}} '''Timeline''' of the [[Gaza War (2008–09)|Gaza War]]. For events pertaining to the conflict which occurred before 27 December 2009, see [[Gaza War (2008–09)#Background]] and [[2007–2008 Israel–Gaza conflict]].
==Timeline==
===December===
====27 December 2008====
Israeli armed forces began operations against Hamas and the rocket launchers at 11:30 a.m., 27 December. More than 50 [[fighter jet]]s and [[attack helicopter]]s entered Gazan airspace. Palestinian sources said that Israeli forces were responsible for killing 225-292 [[Palestinians]] and wounding more than 1,000.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.reliefweb.int/rw/rwb.nsf/db900SID/RMOI-7MXMPD?OpenDocument|title=Gaza offensive enters second week (28 Dec - 03 Jan)|date=3 January 2009| accessdate =3 January 2009}}</ref><ref> {{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/middle_east/7805808.stm|title=Map: Gaza and Israel conflict |date=3 January 2009| accessdate =3 January 2009 | work=BBC News}}</ref><ref name="nydailynews1">[https://web.archive.org/web/20090208030841/http://www.nydailynews.com/news/us_world/2008/12/27/2008-12-27_israel_launches_air_strikes_on_gaza_more.html ''Israel launches air strikes on Gaza, more than 220 dead''] Daily News, 27 December 2008</ref> It was the most extensive attack on Gaza since 1967.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/middle_east/7800985.stm|title=BBC: Massive Israeli air raids on Gaza| accessdate = 27 December 2008 | date=27 December 2008 | work=BBC News}}</ref> The IAF, which said that it was responding to Hamas rocket attacks on southern Israel,<ref name="JPOST">{{cite web|url=http://fr.jpost.com/servlet/Satellite?cid=1230111714969&pagename=JPost/JPArticle/ShowFull|title=A year’s intel yields ‘alpha hits’|last=Katz|first=Yaakov|date=28 December 2008|publisher=The Jerusalem Post|accessdate=28 December 2008|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120111114903/http://fr.jpost.com/servlet/Satellite?cid=1230111714969&pagename=JPost%2FJPArticle%2FShowFull|archivedate=11 January 2012|df=dmy-all}}</ref> dropped more than 100 bombs on 50 targets,<ref name="JPOST"/> which reportedly included [[Hamas]] [[paramilitary]] bases, training camps, and underground [[Qassam rocket]] launchers. Bombs were dropped on government offices, police stations, and the Hamas headquarters.
The aircraft used were [[F-16]] fighter jets and [[AH-64 Apache]] [[helicopters]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.israelnationalnews.com/News/News.aspx/129052|title= Operation ‘Cast Lead’ Begins; One Israeli and 205 Arabs are Dead|last=Ronen|first=Gil |date=27 December 2008|publisher=Israel National News|accessdate=27 December 2008}}</ref><ref name="AFPEgypt">{{cite news|url = https://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5gISje3ZtebFEs6q9IV02RT6CgfsA|title=Egypt slams Israeli murder in Gaza, summons ambassador| date=27 December 2008|publisher=AFP|accessdate=27 December 2008}}</ref><ref name="PNN_injured081227">{{cite news | pages= | title=Israelis kill 225 Palestinians in Gaza and say this is just the beginning | date=27 December 2008 | publisher=[[Palestine News Network]] | url=http://www.sld.cu/galerias/imagen/sitios/mednat/cenament1.jpg | accessdate=27 December 2008 | archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5dOH4OBqa?option=com_content&task=view&id=4297&Itemid=1?url=http://www.sld.cu/galerias/imagen/sitios/mednat/cenament1.jpg | archivedate=27 December 2008 | deadurl=yes | df=dmy-all }}</ref> About 140 members of Hamas security forces were killed, including police chief [[Tawfiq Jabber]], the head of Hamas’ security and protection unit<ref name="Reuters1"/> and the police commander for central Gaza,<ref>[https://news.yahoo.com/s/afp/20081227/ts_afp/mideastconflictgaza_081227164140/print More than 200 dead as Israel hammers Hamas-run Gaza], Yahoo, 27 December 2008</ref> along with at least 15 civilians. Children were among the casualties.<ref name="Reuters1">{{cite news | url = https://www.reuters.com/article/newsOne/idUSLR1342320081227 | publisher = Reuters | date = 27 December 2008 | title = Casualties}}</ref><ref>Rage and Fury in Gaza, http://www.ynet.co.il/articles/0,7340,L-3645284,00.html</ref> The bombed areas included a ceremony for new police officers. About 40 graduates were killed.<ref>{{cite news | first= Tim| last= Butcher| authorlink = Tim Butcher|pages= | title=Israel launches more raids as Gaza death toll rises | date= 28 December 2008 | work=The Daily Telegraph | url= https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/middleeast/palestinianauthority/3983336/Israel-launches-more-raids-as-Gaza-death-toll-rises.html |accessdate=28 December 2008 | location=London}}</ref> A [[mosque]] in [[Gaza City]] was also targeted in the airstrikes and two Palestinians were killed.<ref name=Reuters1227>{{cite news|title=Gaza mosque hit in Israeli air strikes|date=27 December 2008|accessdate=1 January 2009|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/featuredCrisis/idUSLR473226|publisher=Reuters | first=Nidal | last=al-Mughrabi}}</ref> Israeli military spokesmen said that the mosque was being used for "terrorist activities".<ref name=Reuters1227/>
Sixty Israeli planes also targeted Hamas security and military training compounds, as well as weapon storage buildings,<ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/middle_east/7801292.stm| title= Eyewitness: Chaos in Gaza |last=Aboualouf|first=Rushdi|date=27 December 2008|publisher=BBC|accessdate=27 December 2008}}</ref><ref name="iht">{{cite news|url = http://www.iht.com/articles/2008/12/27/africa/28mideast.php|title=Israeli attack kills scores across Gaza|last=El-Khodary|first=Taghreed|author2=Kershner, Isabel |date=27 December 2008|publisher=International Herald Tribune| accessdate =27 December 2008}}</ref> and dropped more than 100 tons of bombs. Some of the bombs used on 27 and 28 December were the U.S. built [[GBU-39 Small Diameter Bomb]], the first shipment of which arrived in Israel at the beginning of the month.<ref>{{cite news |first=Yaakov |last=Katz |title=IAF uses new US-supplied smart bomb |url=http://fr.jpost.com/servlet/Satellite?cid=1230456505080&pagename=JPost/JPArticle/ShowFull |publisher=The Jerusalem Post |date=29 December 2008 |accessdate=28 December 2008 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110713122818/http://fr.jpost.com/servlet/Satellite?cid=1230456505080&pagename=JPost%2FJPArticle%2FShowFull |archivedate=13 July 2011 |df=dmy-all }}</ref>
Hamas later fired 700 rockets and mortars at Israel. One of the rockets hit the town of [[Netivot]], killing an [[Israeli people|Israeli]] man, destroying a house and wounding six other people.<ref name="iht"/><ref name=guardian-ian-black>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2008/dec/27/gaza-attacks-analysis-ian-black|title=Israel’s hammer blow in Gaza|last=Black|first=Ian| date= 27 December 2008|work=The Guardian|accessdate=27 December 2008 | location=London}}</ref> Another rocket hit a [[synagogue]] in the [[Eshkol Regional Council]], injuring two men, one seriously.<ref name=ynet-synagogue-attack>{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-3644954,00.html|title=Man killed in rocket strike| last =Curiel|first=Ilana |date=27 December 2008|publisher=ynetnews|accessdate=27 December 2008}}</ref> In the evening two men in the Israeli community of [[Mivtahim]] were injured, one seriously, by a direct hit by a Hamas rocket{{Citation needed|date=January 2009}}.
According to [[United Nations]] officials, fuel deliveries to the Gaza Strip through the [[Nahal Oz]] crossing were suspended, with the last delivery taking place a day previous on 26 December.<ref name=Leist>{{cite web|title=UN PRESSES FOR FUEL SUPPLIES TO GAZA|url=http://firstread.msnbc.msn.com/archive/2008/12/31/1728756.aspx|publisher=MSNBC|author=Libby Leist|accessdate=1 January 2009|date=31 December 2008}}</ref>
Many Palestinians refer to 27 December as the ''Massacre of the Black Saturday''<ref name="nydailynews1"/> as it produced the highest one-day death toll in 60 years of conflict.<ref name="Alarabiya1">[http://www.alarabiya.net/articles/2008/12/27/62895.html At least 205 killed as Israeli pounds Gaza], [[Alarabiya]], 27 December 2008</ref>
====28 December 2008====
Twenty-five airstrikes were carried out on Sunday by Israel, raising the number of casualties to 287 dead and 900 wounded.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/2008-12/28/content_10570955.htm|title=Israel continues airstrikes on Gaza, 271 killed |date=28 December 2008|publisher=China View|accessdate=28 December 2008}}</ref> According to the Egyptian Foreign Minister Ahmed Aboul Gheit, Hamas refused to allow casualties to leave Gaza for medical treatment.<ref name="ReutersAfrica">{{cite news|url=http://africa.reuters.com/top/news/usnJOE4BR01X.html|title=Hamas denying Gaza wounded treatment in Egypt|date=28 December 2008|publisher=Reuters Africa|accessdate=28 December 2008|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5dSFwkJaH?url=http://africa.reuters.com/top/news/usnJOE4BR01X.html|archivedate=30 December 2008}}</ref> One rocket shot by an [[F-16]] fighter jet on a [[mosque]] near [[Shifa Hospital]] in [[Gaza City]], from which rockets were reported by Israeli media to be launched, killed four members of Hamas.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ynet.co.il/articles/0,7340,L-3645293,00.html |title=Ynet לילה של תקיפות: 4 פלסטינים נהרגו במסגד - חדשות |publisher=Ynet.co.il |accessdate=28 December 2008}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.islamonline.net/servlet/Satellite?c=Article_C&cid=1230414051024&pagename=Zone-English-News/NWELayout|title=Israel's Shock & Awe Planned 6 Months |date=28 December 2008|publisher=Islam Online |accessdate=28 December 2008}}</ref> In Gaza City, five children from the same family were killed in an Israeli airstrike.<ref name = "Guardian Israel and the Palestinians Middle East">{{cite news | url = https://www.theguardian.com/world/2008/dec/30/israel-and-the-palestinians-middle-east | accessdate = 3 January 2009 | publisher = The Guardian | location = Jerusalem, IL | title = 'I didn't see any of my girls, just a pile of bricks' | first = Hazem | last = Jabalia |author2=Rory McCarthy | date = 30 December 2008}}</ref> Israeli jets bombed tunnels in the [[Rafah]] area. These tunnels were reportedly used to smuggle civilian goods and weapons after Israel and Egypt imposed the [[Blockade of the Gaza Strip|blockade of Gaza]] in June 2007.<ref name="tun1">{{cite web|url=http://www.france24.com/en/20081228-israel-gaza-strip-raid-smuggling-tunnel-egypt-border|title=Israel bombs border tunnels between Egypt-Gaza|date=28 December 2008|publisher=France 24|accessdate=4 January 2009}}</ref><ref name="tun2">{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/middle_east/7801662.stm|title=Israeli jets target Gaza tunnels|date=28 December 2008|publisher=BBC|accessdate=4 January 2009}}</ref><ref name="nytdec28">{{cite news| last = ElKhodary, Taghreed | url = https://www.nytimes.com/2008/12/29/world/middleeast/29mideast.html|title=Israeli Attacks in Gaza Strip Continue for Second Day|publisher=New York Times|date=28 December 2008|accessdate=30 December 2008|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090410134613/http://www.nytimes.com/2008/12/29/world/middleeast/29mideast.html| dead-url = no |archivedate=10 April 2009}}</ref> The main road of Sallah el-Dein in northern Gaza Strip was bombed. The road leads to the towns of [[Beit Hanoun]], [[Beit Lahia]] and [[Jabalia]]. No injuries were reported in the bombing.
An Israeli air-to-ground rocket destroyed a metal workshop in northern Gaza City which, according to Israel, was used in manufacturing Qassam rockets fired at Israel. The Al-Noor organisation in Gaza City, belonging to the Hamas organization, was bombed, causing severe damage to the building.<ref name="Saladin">{{cite web|url=http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/2008-12/28/content_10568951.htm|title=Israel resumes airstrikes on the Gaza Strip |date=28 December 2008|publisher=China View|accessdate=28 December 2008}}</ref> The main building of the Hamas-owned [[Al-Aqsa TV]] station was struck.<ref name="AlAqsa">{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2008/12/29/world/middleeast/29mideast.html?hp|title=Israeli Troops Mass Along Border; Arab Anger Rises|date=28 December 2008|last=El-Khodari|first=Taghreed|publisher=New York Times|archivedate=4 November 2015|dead-url=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151104210810/http://www.nytimes.com/2008/12/29/world/middleeast/29mideast.html?hp}}</ref> The station continued broadcasting via a "mobile unit".<ref name="aljazeera_mosque_tv">{{cite news | pages= | title= Israel resumes Gaza bombardment| date=28 December 2008 | publisher=[[al Jazeera]] | url=http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2008/12/20081227193910425276.html |accessdate=28 December 2008}}</ref> [[Aidan White (journalist)|Aidan White]], Secretary-General of the [[International Federation of Journalists]] condemned the destruction of the television station, stating that [[international law]] "forbids attacks on media installations, even when they are instruments of propaganda".<ref name="IFJ_alaqsa_destroyed">{{cite web| title =IFJ Condemns Israel for Strike on Television During Gaza Blitz| work =| publisher =[[International Federation of Journalists]]| date =28 December 2008| url =http://www.ifj.org/en/articles/ifj-condemns-israel-for-strike-on-television-during-gaza-blitz |format =| doi =| accessdate =31 December 2008 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5dT3xF7ym?url=http://www.ifj.org/en/articles/ifj-condemns-israel-for-strike-on-television-during-gaza-blitz |archivedate=31 December 2008 }}</ref> The IAF attacked [[Jabalia]] and northern Gaza killing two more people and wounding others.<ref name="imemc">{{cite web|url=http://www.imemc.org/article/58179|title=At least four more killed in a new Israeli strike in Gaza|date=28 December 2008|publisher=Internationale Middle East Media Center|accessdate=28 December 2008}}</ref>
Al Saraya, a building in Gaza City which contained government offices, security offices and a prison, was attacked. Four people died.<ref name="imemc"/> A fuel [[lorry]] traveling in [[Rafah]] near the Egyptian border was destroyed, killing six people.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thenational.ae/article/20081228/FOREIGN/244163354/-1/ART|title=Israeli air strikes continue|date=28 December 2008|publisher=The National|accessdate=28 December 2008}}</ref> IDF also confirmed an attack on tunnels in [[Philadelphi Route]] and claimed successful destruction of 40 of them.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-3645907,00.html|title=IDF targets Rafah smuggling tunnels|date=28 December 2008|publisher=Ynetnews|accessdate=28 December 2008}}</ref> Missiles also hit near the Beit Hanoun City Hall.<ref>[http://edition.cnn.com/2008/WORLD/meast/12/28/gaza.israel.strikes/index.html?eref=edition Israeli airstrikes in Gaza enter third day] [[CNN]]. 28 December 2008.</ref>
Rockets were fired from the Gaza Strip, the range of which were extended. Three rockets landed near the city of [[Ashdod]] – the fifth largest Israeli city and a main sea port.<ref name=ynet-ashdod-rockets>{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-3645485,00.html|title=Rockets land east of Ashdod|date=28 December 2008|publisher=Ynetnews|accessdate=28 December 2008}}</ref> The border with Egypt was breached and inhabitants from Gaza moved into Egypt. One Egyptian [[border police]]man was killed by Palestinian gunmen, and several Palestinians were wounded by Egyptian gunfire and taken to hospital in Egypt.<ref>{{cite web |last=Jpost |first=By |url=http://fr.jpost.com/servlet/Satellite?cid=1230456500516&pagename=JPost/JPArticle/ShowFull |title=Gaza Palestinians cross Egyptian border | Middle East | Jerusalem Post |publisher=Jpost.com |accessdate=28 December 2008 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5dXRlxj3J?url=http://www.jpost.com/servlet/Satellite?cid=1230456500516&pagename=JPost%2FJPArticle%2FShowFull |archivedate=3 January 2009 |df=dmy-all }}</ref>
The [[United Nations Security Council]] held a closed door meeting convened at the request of Libya. The meeting lasted four hours,<ref name="worsnip1">{{cite news|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/newsMaps/idUSTRE4BR0H920081228|title=U.N. Security Council calls for end to Gaza violence|last=Worsnip|first=Patrick |author2=Todd Eastham |date=28 December 2008|publisher=Reuters |accessdate=28 December 2008}}</ref> and resulted in a press statement calling "on the parties to stop immediately all military activities ... [and] to address the serious humanitarian and economic needs in Gaza and to take necessary measures, including opening of border crossings."<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.un.org/News/Press/docs//2008/sc9559.doc.htm|title=Security Council Press Statement on Situation in Gaza|date=28 December 2008}}</ref>
On the eve of the ground incursion by Israeli forces, Khaled Mashal assured that should IDF launch ground offensive, black destiny and abduction awaits Israeli soldiers.<ref name=Hamas>{{Cite news| title=Hamas threatens 'black destiny' if Israeli soldiers enter Gaza| url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/middleeast/palestinianauthority/4077764/Hamas-threatens-black-destiny-if-Israeli-soldiers-enter-Gaza.html| work=The Daily Telegraph| date=3 January 2009 | location=London | first=Tim | last=Butcher | accessdate=2 April 2010}}</ref><ref name="Israel continues Gaza assault">{{Cite news| title=Israel continues Gaza assault| url=http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2009/01/20091316557303315.html| publisher=[[Al Jazeera]]| date=3 January 2009}}</ref> Hamas spokesman added that with the God's help Gaza will become a graveyard to Israeli troops.<ref name="Israel rolls its tanks into Gaza to storm Hamas rocket bases">{{Cite news| title=Israel rolls its tanks into Gaza to storm Hamas rocket bases| url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/worldnews/article-1103314/Israel-rolls-tanks-Gaza-storm-Hamas-rocket-bases.html| work=[[Dailymail]]| date=4 January 2009 | location=London | first=Jane | last=Flanagan}}</ref>
====29 December 2008====
Air strikes on the Strip continued. Just after midnight on 29 December, Israeli forces made six separate airstrikes against the [[Islamic University of Gaza]], a "cultural symbol" of Hamas,<ref name="HamasCulturalSymbol1">{{Cite news | title = Israel bombs Islamic University in Gaza: Hamas | date = 28 December 2008 | publisher = Reuters | url = https://www.reuters.com/article/topNews/idUSTRE4BR2F920081228 | accessdate = 29 December 2008 | archiveurl = https://www.webcitation.org/5dQphA0YB?url=http://www.reuters.com/article/topNews/idUSTRE4BR2F920081228 | archivedate = 29 December 2008 }}</ref><ref name="HamasCulturalSymbol2">{{Cite news | title=Israel bombs university in Gaza | date=28 December 2008 | publisher=BBC | url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/middle_east/7802515.stm | accessdate=29 December 2008 | archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5dPrKOjVe?url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/middle_east/7802515.stm | archivedate=29 December 2008 }}</ref> though the university had evacuated days in advance. According to [[The Jerusalem Post]], the university hosts Hamas military laboratories under the auspices of professors and its buildings were used for storing rockets and explosives.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://fr.jpost.com/servlet/Satellite?cid=1230111723191&pagename=JPost/JPArticle/ShowFull |title=Hamas military labs in Islamic university bombed |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120111091227/http://fr.jpost.com/servlet/Satellite?cid=1230111723191&pagename=JPost%2FJPArticle%2FShowFull |archivedate=11 January 2012 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> According to the [[Israel Defense Forces|IDF]] and the [[Shin Bet]], one compound near the Islamic [[college]], which was bombed twice, was being used as a chemical lab and as a Hamas [[explosives]] lab; Israel said that Hamas had been working to improve [[rocket]]s and manufacture [[Mortar (weapon)|mortar]] shells.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-3650367,00.html | title = Livni: Shelling Gaza College a hit on 'death sciences' department | publisher = [[YNET]] | date = 4 January 2009 }}</ref> Israel asserted that the university chemistry laboratory was a "fair target", even if it could not show conclusively that those inside the laboratory at the time of the attack where engaged in making weapons.<ref>{{cite news|last=El-Khodary|first=Taghreed|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2009/01/01/world/middleeast/01gaza.html?hp | title = In Dense Gaza, Civilians Suffer | publisher = New York Times | date = 31 December 2008 }}</ref>
The death toll rose to 415 that morning, as reported by the [[Associated Press]]. The [[Interior Minister of the Palestinian National Authority|Palestinian interior ministry in Gaza]] building was hit by Israeli missiles at dawn. The university and the ministry are both located in the [[Tel al-Hawa]] neighborhood.<ref name="BBC_IslUnivGaza_bombed" >{{cite web|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/middle_east/7802515.stm|title=BBC NEWS - Middle East - Israel strikes key Hamas offices|publisher=|accessdate=6 December 2014}}</ref>
A mosque in the [[Jabaliya refugee camp]] was also bombed by the IAF. The building was destroyed and five young girls whose house neighboured the mosque were killed.<ref name = "bbc_Oct29">{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/middle_east/7802515.stm|title=Israel strikes key Hamas offices|date=29 December 2008|publisher=BBC|accessdate=29 December 2008}}</ref> Ziad Abu-Tir, a senior member of the [[Islamic Jihad Movement in Palestine|Islamic Jihad]]'s military wing was killed in a strike in the [[Khan Younis]] area.<ref name="IslamicJihad">[http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-3646633,00.html Senior Jihad man, 14 others die in IDF strikes], Ynet, 29 December 2008</ref>
The [[International Red Cross and Red Crescent Movement|International Red Cross]] reported that hospitals in the Gaza Strip were overwhelmed and unable to cope with the casualties.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/newsOne/idUSLS69391620081229?pageNumber=2&virtualBrandChannel=10112|title=Israel expands Gaza campaign as militants fire rockets|work=Reuters|accessdate=6 December 2014}}</ref> Red Cross spokesman in Gaza Iyad Nasr said Gaza needed more supplies to be brought in urgently, "in particular the hospitals have been depleted and stretched to the maximum because of the closure imposed".<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/middle_east/7805558.stm Israel rejects Gaza truce calls] BBC News 31 December 2008</ref> According to the IDF, Israel permitted a number of [[Turkey|Turkish]]-donated ambulances from the West Bank to be transported to the Gaza Strip, as well as Red Cross, UNRWA, [[World Food Programme]] and [[Médecins Sans Frontières|Doctors Without Borders]] medical supplies.<ref name="bamahane">{{cite news|url=http://dover.idf.il/IDF/News_Channels/today/08/12/2902.htm |title=Ambulances from West Bank Transported to Gaza Strip |publisher=[[Bamahane]] |author=Sneh, Rani |date=29 December 2008 |accessdate=30 December 2008 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090124163835/http://dover.idf.il/IDF/News_Channels/today/08/12/2902.htm |archivedate=24 January 2009 }}</ref>
The Israeli city of [[Ashkelon]] was hit by a [[BM-21|Grad]] rocket, killing an [[Israeli-Arab]]<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/middle-east/three-israelis-killed-as-hamas-launches-revenge-attacks-1216226.html|title=Three Israelis killed as Hamas launches revenge attacks|work=The Independent|accessdate=6 December 2014}}</ref> construction worker and seriously wounding three other people.<ref name = "bbc_Oct29"/> Nahal Oz army base in Southern Israel was hit by mortar fire, killing one soldier, who was later identified as Lutfi Nasraldin. The attacks increased pressure on the government as the army amassed [[infantry]] and armored forces along the border.<ref>{{Cite news | title = Israel expands Gaza campaign as terrorists fire rockets | date = 29 December 2008 | publisher = Reuters | url = https://www.reuters.com/article/newsOne/idUSLS69391620081229 }}</ref>
Israel's military intelligence chief said that Hamas' ability to fire rockets had been reduced by 50 percent, but that Hamas continued to command "some 20,000 fighters".<ref>[http://www.newsday.com/news/nationworld/ny-womide295981030dec29,0,136900.story Israel widens air attack against Hamas in Gaza] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090102065857/http://www.newsday.com/news/nationworld/ny-womide295981030dec29,0,136900.story |date=2 January 2009 }}</ref>
The foreign ministry of [[Senegal]] reported that [[exile]]d Hamas leader [[Khaled Meshaal]] was ready to sign an immediate ceasefire with Israel, provided Israel lifted its blockade on the Gaza Strip.<ref>{{cite news|title=Senegal says Hamas chief ready to sign Gaza truce|publisher=[[Agence France-Presse|AFP]]|date=29 December 2008|url=https://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5j_M9u-BCLrmMxywbVPVzzEhjLqog| archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5dUYr6MwW?url=http://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5j_M9u-BCLrmMxywbVPVzzEhjLqog | archivedate=1 January 2009}}</ref>
On 29 December an IDF spokesperson confirmed for the first time that, apart from maintaining the naval blockade on Gaza, the [[Israeli Navy]] was taking an active part in the operation.<ref name="IDF 2901">{{cite news|url=http://dover.idf.il/IDF/English/News/the_Front/08/12/2901.htm |title=Operation Cast Lead Continues: IAF and IN Forces Strike Hamas |publisher=Israel Defense Forces |location=Israel |accessdate=3 January 2009 |date=29 December 2008 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090131192304/http://dover.idf.il/IDF/English/News/the_Front/08/12/2901.htm |archivedate=31 January 2009 }}</ref> A video taken by the Israeli Navy and published on several news sites<ref name=haaretz-video-naval >{{cite news | url = http://www.haaretz.co.il/hasite/spages/1051000.html | publisher = Ha'aretz | accessdate = 4 January 2009 | script-title=he:מבצע "עופרת יצוקה": תקיפת חיל הים ברצועת עזה: כך זה נראה | language = Hebrew | date = 29 December 2008}}</ref> showed the Israeli Navy attacking the Gaza coast line, using both [[Typhoon Weapon System]] and [[surface-to-surface missile]]s.
According to [[Haaretz]], among the targets hit by the Israeli Navy were Ismayil Haniah's offices, several command and control centers used by Hamas, and a Hamas patrol boat.<ref name=haaretz-video-naval /> On 31 December, the Israeli Navy "targeted a number of Hamas outposts and rocket launching sites", according to the IDF spokesperson.<ref name=idf-brief-naval>{{cite web|url=http://dover.idf.il/IDF/English/News/the_Front/09/01/0101.htm |publisher=Israel Defense Forces |title=IAF and IN Strike Additional Hamas Targets, Operation Continues |accessdate=4 January 2009 |date=1 January 2009 |location=Israel |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090122141003/http://dover.idf.il/IDF/English/News/the_Front/09/01/0101.htm |archivedate=22 January 2009 }}</ref> On 4 January, Israel extended the naval blockade from {{convert|6|to(-)|20|nmi|km mi|lk=in}} to prevent all vessels from entering the Strip.<ref>{{cite news|title=Israeli ground troops enter Gaza|url=http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2009/01/20091322357629723.html|date=4 January 2009|publisher=[[Al-Jazeera]]}}</ref>
=====Dignity incident=====
On 29 December 2008, the [[Free Gaza Movement]] motor yacht ''Dignity'' set course from [[Cyprus]], carrying aid to Gaza.<ref name="BBC Dignity">{{cite news | pages= | title=Gaza aid boat 'rammed by Israel' | date=30 December 2008 | publisher=BBC | url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/middle_east/7805075.stm |accessdate=6 January 2009 }}</ref> The boat, which carried [[Ireland|Irish]] [[human rights]] activist [[Caoimhe Butterly]], former [[United States Representative]] and 2008 [[Green Party (United States)|Green Party]] nominee for [[President of the United States|U.S. President]] [[Cynthia McKinney]], journalists from [[Al Jazeera]] and [[CNN]] such as Karl Penhaul,<ref name=CNNFGM>{{cite news|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2008/WORLD/meast/12/30/gaza.aid.boat/index.html?eref=rss_topstories|title=Gaza relief boat damaged in encounter with Israeli vessel - CNN.com|publisher=cnn.com|accessdate=30 December 2008| date=30 December 2008}}</ref> and three [[surgeon]]s including Dr. [[Elena Theoharous]], a member of the [[House of Representatives of Cyprus|Cyprus Parliament]],<ref name="FGM_passengers">{{cite web | title =Passengers List (Dignity has left Cyprus) | work = | publisher =[[Free Gaza Movement]] | date =29 December 2008 | url =http://www.freegaza.org/index.php?module=latest_news&id=e6e88796fa7572401f2cb07e5b970612&offset= | format = | doi = | accessdate =30 December 2008 | archiveurl =https://www.webcitation.org/5dSN82B21?url=http://www.freegaza.org/index.php?module=latest_news&id=e6e88796fa7572401f2cb07e5b970612&offset= | archivedate =30 December 2008 | deadurl =yes | df =dmy-all }}</ref> attempted to enter the [[Gaza Strip]], carrying {{convert|3.5|t|short ton|lk=on}} of medical supplies.<ref name = "BBC Dignity" /><ref name="Haaretz_FreeGM_081230">{{cite news | pages= | title=Pro-Palestinian activists say Israel Navy fired on protest boat off Gaza shore | date=30 December 2008 | publisher=[[Haaretz]]/[[Reuters]] | url=http://www.haaretz.com/hasen/spages/1051224.html | accessdate=30 December 2008 | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081231035529/http://www.haaretz.com/hasen/spages/1051224.html | dead-url=yes | archivedate=31 December 2008 | df=dmy-all }}</ref> Its passengers stated that several [[Israeli navy|Israeli naval vessels]] approached their boat.<ref name="guardian_FGM_rammed">{{cite news | first=Mark | last=Tran | pages= | title=Israel accused of ramming Gaza aid ship | date=30 December 2008 | publisher=Guardian | url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2008/dec/30/israel-gaza-aid-ship |accessdate=30 December 2008 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5dSOqGqQ5?url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/2008/dec/30/israel-gaza-aid-ship |archivedate=30 December 2008 | location=London}}</ref> Free Gaza member David Halpin said that Israeli officers on board asked the captain to halt the ''Dignity'''s course to Gaza, but he refused.<ref name="reuters_FGM_rammed">{{cite news | title=Gaza aid boat damaged by Israelis reaches Lebanon | date=30 December 2008 | publisher=Reuters | url=http://uk.reuters.com/article/UKNews1/idUKTRE4BT28120081230?sp=true | first=Allyn | last=Fisher-Ilan}}</ref> According to CNN reporter Penhaul an Israeli vessel rammed the motor yacht, causing heavy damage.<ref name=CNNFGM/><ref name="guardian_FGM_rammed" /> Penhaul has admittedly stated he did not have a view of the Israeli vessel at the time.<ref>Penhaul's walkthrough report, [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xgddT_i9260 Youtube]</ref> Other passengers said that several Israeli vessels fired machine guns into the water.<ref name="guardian_FGM_rammed" /> The activists stated that their boat was clearly in [[international waters]], about "70-80 miles"<ref name="Haaretz_FreeGM_081230" /><ref>{{convert|70|-|80|mi|nmi km}}</ref> or "90 miles"<ref name="guardian_FGM_rammed" /><ref>{{convert|90|mi|nmi km}}</ref> from the Gaza Strip coast. McKinney said that the Israeli vessel had rammed the boat "approximately three times, twice in the front and once in the side".
Israeli foreign ministry spokesman Yigal Palmor said that no shooting had occurred,<ref name="Reuters_FGM">{{cite news | first= Allyn| last= Fisher-Ilan| pages= | title=Israeli naval ship clashes with Gaza aid boat | date=30 December 2008 | publisher=Reuters | url=http://uk.reuters.com/article/UKNews1/idUKTRE4BT28120081230?sp=true |accessdate=30 December 2008 }}</ref> and that the motor yacht was inside Israeli territorial waters, and that the boat had failed to respond to Israeli naval radio contact.<ref name="guardian_FGM_rammed" /> Palmor said that the ''Dignity'' had crashed into an Israel vessel while attempting to outmanoeuvre it.<ref name="IHT_FGM_boatcrash">{{cite news|pages= |title=Gaza protest boat sails into Lebanon |date=30 December 2008 |publisher=International Herald Tribune/[[Associated Press]] |url=http://www.iht.com/articles/ap/2008/12/30/news/ML-Lebanon-Gaza-Boat.php |accessdate=30 December 2008 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090124171729/http://www.iht.com/articles/ap/2008/12/30/news/ML-Lebanon-Gaza-Boat.php |archivedate=24 January 2009 }}</ref><ref name="YNET_FGM081230">[[YNET]] [http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-3647005,00.html Navy orders aid boat to Gaza to retreat], 30 December 2008</ref> Palmor also said that the fact that the ship was carrying journalists, including a CNN crew that had already broadcast live three times, proved that the incident was a provocation on the part of the media.<ref name="YNET_FGM081230"/> Immediately after the incident, the boat turned back. Palmor stated that the naval ship offered to assist the passengers but that they had declined the offer.<ref name="UK_Guardian_ship">{{cite news | title=Israel accused of ramming Gaza aid boat|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2008/dec/30/israel-gaza-aid-ship|date=30 December 2008|accessdate=31 December 2008 | work=The Guardian | location=London | first=Mark | last=Tran}}</ref> Palmor also stated that Israeli ships escorted the damaged boat to Cypriot territorial waters.<ref name="UK_Guardian_ship"/> It did not have enough fuel to return to Cyprus and ended up docking in [[Lebanon]], where it was greeted with cheering crowds.<ref name = "BBC Dignity" /><ref name="IHT_FGM_boatcrash" />
Cypriot Foreign Minister [[Markos Kyprianou]] stated that [[Cyprus]] would lodge a formal complaint regarding the incident.<ref name="guardian_FGM_rammed" /> In a written statement, the Consulate General of Israel to the Southeast USA, based in [[Atlanta, Georgia|Atlanta]], Georgia, said that McKinney "has taken it upon herself to commit an act of provocation", endangering herself and the crew, and called her behavior "irresponsible".<ref name=CNNFGM/>
====30 December 2008==== Israeli air-strikes struck five ministerial buildings, another structure owned by Islamic University, a sports center, two Hamas training camps, the home of a senior Hamas commander (who was not present), and offices of the [[Popular Resistance Committees]]. 10 fatalities were reported.<ref>{{cite news |first=Nidal |last=al-Mughrabi |title=WRAPUP 1-Israel presses on with Gaza air attacks, 10 dead |url=http://africa.reuters.com/wire/news/usnLU691622.html |publisher=Reuters |date=30 December 2008 |accessdate=30 December 2008 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081231121426/http://africa.reuters.com/wire/news/usnLU691622.html |archivedate=31 December 2008 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> The "whole compound" of ministerial buildings in [[Gaza City]], including the [[Governance of the Gaza Strip|Ministries of Finance, Interior and Education]], were "completely destroyed" by 30 December.<ref name="IMEMC_ministries">{{cite news | first=Rami | last=Almeghari | pages= | title=Deserted streets and fear as Israel demolishes Gaza | date=30 December 2008 | publisher=[[International Middle East Media Center]] | url=http://www.imemc.org/article/58243 |accessdate=31 December 2008 }}</ref> The [[International Middle East Media Center]] stated that the ministries were "not 'terrorist' or military sites" and that the buildings were "civilian buildings that served the population in civil matters".<ref name="IMEMC_ministries" /> The premises of the Gaza Community Mental Health Programme (GCMHP) were destroyed.<ref name=Reliefweb0601>{{cite web|title=Amid intense bombings Gaza's children suffer serious mental trauma|author=International Rehabilitation Council for Torture Victims (IRCT)|date=6 January 2009|accessdate=6 January 2009|url=http://www.reliefweb.int/rw/rwb.nsf/db900SID/MCOT-7N2E8R?OpenDocument|publisher=ReliefWeb}}</ref><ref name="reuterstruce">[https://www.reuters.com/article/newsOne/idUSLS69391620081230 Israel rejects truce, presses on with Gaza strikes] Reuters 30 December 2008</ref>
Gazans said that most Israeli strikes came without warning, but Israeli forces said in reply that they offered general warnings by dropping leaflets and by interrupting radio broadcasts telling Gaza residents to flee their homes if they were hiding weapons or terrorists.<ref>[https://www.google.com/hostednews/ap/article/ALeqM5jwiDL_nGeC63bi_l8-3JB2WVc1xwD95CLD880 Israeli airstrikes kill dozens of Gaza civilians] [[Associated Press]] 30 December 2008 {{dead link|date=May 2016|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}}</ref> [[Amnesty International]] argued that "there are no 'safe' places in Gaza for civilians to seek shelter".<ref>[http://english.pnn.ps/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=4369&Itemid=1 Amnesty International: there are no safe places in Gaza] [[Palestine News Network]] 1 January 2009</ref>
Israel kept schools closed within a radius of about {{convert|50|km|mi|abbr=on}} from the Gaza border, citing concerns about further rocket fire. Residents were told to remain indoors and on the alert for alarms heralding incoming rockets.<ref>[https://www.reuters.com/article/newsOne/idUSLS6391620081230?pageNumber=2&virtualBrandChannel=0 Reuters Dec 30] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303190308/https://www.reuters.com/article/newsOne/idUSLS6391620081230?pageNumber=2&virtualBrandChannel=0 |date=3 March 2016 }}</ref> Hamas launched Chinese-made rockets at [[Beersheba]], a city in southern Israel. A Grad missile landed in an empty [[kindergarten]], causing damage.<ref name=ynet-school-rocket >{{cite web | title = Rockets reach Beersheba, cause damage | url= http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-3647569,00.html | publisher = [[YNET]] | date = 30 December 2008 }}</ref> 24 Qassam rockets and 11 mortars were fired into Israel, causing some damage but no injuries.<ref name="dec31">[[CNN]] [http://www.cnn.com/2008/WORLD/meast/12/21/israel.gaza/index.html#cnnSTCText?iref=werecommend Israel fires back at Gaza, as Israeli PM vows more], 31 December 2008</ref>
Egypt said it would only fully open its border with the Gaza Strip if the crossing post were to come under the control of Mahmoud Abbas's [[Palestinian Authority]].<ref>[http://www.haaretz.com/hasen/pages/ShArtStEng.jhtml?itemNo=1051238&contrassID=1&subContrassID=1&title='Mubarak:%20We'll%20open%20Gaza%20crossing%20only%20if%20Abbas'%20PA%20takes%20control%20of%20it'&dyn_server=172.20.5.5 Mubarak: We'll open Gaza crossing only if PA takes control], ''Haaretz'', 31 December 2008</ref>
Israel had banned reporters from entering the Gaza strip since November 2008, citing security reasons. A petition made by 400 foreign journalists to enter the Gaza Strip was filed with Israel's supreme court.<ref name="reportersdec30">{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2008/dec/30/israel-gaza-journalists|title=Foreign journalists demand Gaza access|author=Rory McCarthy|work=the Guardian|accessdate=6 December 2014}}</ref>
Israel permitted 100 trucks carrying humanitarian supplies to enter the Gaza Strip via the [[Kerem Shalom]] border crossing. Five ambulances donated by [[Turkey]] were also allowed entry.<ref>{{cite web |title = Israel lets 100 aid trucks into Gaza via Kerem Shalom border crossing |url = http://fr.jpost.com/servlet/Satellite?cid=1230456528631&pagename=JPost/JPArticle/ShowFull |publisher = [[Jerusalem Post]] |date = 30 December 2008 }}{{Dead link|date=July 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=no }}</ref><ref>[http://www.todayszaman.com/tz-web/detaylar.do?load=detay&link=162783 Turkish aid to arrive in Gaza Strip on Thursday]{{Dead link|date=July 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=no }}</ref>
====31 December 2008==== About 35 Hamas fighters and five Palestinians civilians were killed during continued air strikes,<ref name=HAA2/> as UNRWA reported that at least 25 percent of the dead thus far in the conflict had been civilians.<ref>{{cite news|title=25 percent of Gaza killed civilians: UN|url=http://www.metimes.com/Politics/2008/12/31/25_percent_of_gaza_killed_civilians_un/afp/|date=31 December 2009}}{{Dead link|date=July 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=no }}</ref> Israel continued bombing, striking "dozens of targets" including smuggling tunnels along the Gaza–Egypt border.<ref name=HAA2>[http://www.haaretz.com/hasen/spages/1051542.html Israel decides to push on with Gaza op until 'all goals reached'] Haaretz, 31 December 2008</ref>
During the morning, two more rockets launched from Gaza hit the city of [[Beersheba]]; one of the rockets hit a school, causing severe damage to the building, but no casualties, as Israeli authorities instructed schools to remain closed. Two rockets landed in the Israeli city of [[Ashkelon]], causing light injuries to two people; another rocket hit the town of [[Ofakim]]; several more landed around these cities and the cities of [[Kiryat Gat]], [[Kiryat Malachi]] and [[Ashdod]].<ref name="dec31_ynetnews">[[ynetnews]] [http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-3647765,00.html Rocket hits Beersheba school; no injuries], 31 December 2008</ref> Altogether, more than 60 [[Katyusha rocket launcher|Katyusha]] and Qassam rockets were fired from Gaza into Israel.<ref name = "Haaretz 1051235">{{cite news | url = http://www.haaretz.com/hasen/spages/1051235.html | title = 4 rockets hit south as 'special situation' status extended to 40 kilometers from Gaza border | publisher = Haaretz | location = Jerusalem, IL | accessdate = 3 January 2009 | date = 31 December 2008 | first = Yanir | last = Yagna}}</ref><ref name=autogenerated1>[[CNN]] [https://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20090101/ap_on_re_mi_ea/ml_israel_palestinians Israel sends more troops to Gaza border], 31 December 2008 {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090101180426/http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20090101/ap_on_re_mi_ea/ml_israel_palestinians |date=1 January 2009 }}</ref>
According to UN humanitarian coordinator [[Max Gaylard]], Gaza's hospitals were facing severe strain dealing with "their largest ever trauma caseloads under some of the most adverse conditions imaginable".<ref name = "AFP ALeqM5jU">{{cite news | url = https://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5jUVFj2FFlw_tbB6dvEFTCqMLBI_g | publisher = Google | agency = AFP | location = Gaza City, PS | title = Hamas defiant as Israel rejects Gaza truce | accessdate = 3 January 2009 | date = 1 January 2009}}</ref> [[Douglas Alexander]], Britain's [[International Development Secretary]] is quoted saying "Thousands are suffering. Medical items are in short supply. Fuel shortages have led to power cuts which in turn are affecting hospitals and other essential services. And UN stocks of food are very low. The limited aid that is getting through cannot be distributed properly because of bombing from the air and rocket attacks launched from inside Gaza".<ref name = "Express 77879">{{cite web | url = http://www.express.co.uk/posts/view/77879/Israel-rejects-Gaza-ceasefire-plea | title = Israel Rejects Gaza Ceasefire Plea | publisher = Daily Express | first = Emily | last = Garnham | date = 31 December 2008 | accessdate = 3 January 2009 | location = London, UK}}</ref> A seriously injured six-year-old Palestinian boy was allowed to be transferred from Gaza to an Israeli children's hospital for treatment.<ref name="dec31b_ynetnews">[[ynetnews]] [http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-3648072,00.html Seriously injured Gazan boy transferred to Israeli hospital], 31 December 2008</ref>
Israel rejected international appeals proposed by the French [[Foreign Minister]] [[Bernard Kouchner]] to grant a 48-hour cease-fire, saying that conditions were not right for the ceasefire.<ref name="bbc_dec_31_truce">{{cite news |title=Israel rejects Gaza truce calls |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/middle_east/7805558.stm |publisher=BBC |date=31 December 2008 |accessdate=31 December 2008 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5dU02mthA?url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/middle_east/7805558.stm |archivedate=31 December 2008 }}</ref><ref name="Yahoo 20081231 ML Israel Palestinians">{{cite news|url=https://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20081231/ap_on_re_mi_ea/ml_israel_palestinians |publisher=Yahoo! |agency=Associated Press |date=31 December 2008 |accessdate=3 January 2009 |title=Israel sends more troops to Gaza border |first=Ibrahim |last=BARZAK |author2=Jason KEYSER |location=Gaza City, PS |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090103223032/http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20081231/ap_on_re_mi_ea/ml_israel_palestinians |archivedate=3 January 2009 }}</ref> Meanwhile, Hamas spokesman [[Ayman Taha]] told the AFP agency that Hamas is open to any ceasefire proposition that will end the Israeli airstrikes and stop the [[Blockade of the Gaza Strip|Gaza blockade]].<ref name="bbc_dec_31_truce" /> Palestinian president [[Mahmoud Abbas]], threatened to halt peace talks if they go against the Palestinian interests and offer support for "aggression".<ref name="bbc_dec_31_truce" />
In a briefing to the Israeli cabinet, [[Shin Bet]] Chief [[Yuval Diskin]] said that Hamas has suffered significant damages and its rule over Gaza has been compromised, and that many Hamas operatives are hiding in hospitals, posing as medical staff, or hiding in [[mosques]] and using them as headquarters, since they assumed Israel won't attack them there.<ref name = "ynet_hamas_gunmen_hiding_in_hospitals">{{cite web | title = Gaza: Hamas gunmen hide in hospitals | url= http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-3648020,00.html | publisher = [[YNET]] | date = 31 December 2008 }}</ref> According to the [[Israeli air force]], Hamas cells have been firing rockets from within densely populated areas and attempting to use Palestinian civilians as human shields. Cells have been detected in neighborhoods in [[Gaza City]], [[Jabalya]], [[Khan Younis]] and [[Rafah]]. The Israel Defense Forces has distributed flyers to the Palestinian population in Gaza, warning civilians not to stay close to any Hamas related buildings, for their own safety.<ref name = "ynet_hamas_gunmen_hiding_in_hospitals"/> The Israeli Air Force bombed a Gaza Strip mosque. According to the IDF the mosque was used by Hamas as a storage site for missiles and explosive materials and that rocket cells were firing at Israel from the mosque area and from nearby sites. According to [[ynet]], the attack on the mosque was carried out after legal consultation with IDF experts on international law.<ref name = "ynet_terror mosque">{{cite web | title = IDF bombs 'terror mosque | url= http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-3648349,00.html | publisher = [[YNET]] | date = 31 December 2008 }}</ref>
Israel's supreme court, in response to a court petition heard the previous day,<ref name="jtadec31">[http://jta.org/news/article/2008/12/31/1001913/high-court-let-correspondents-into-gaza Court: Let reporters into Gaza]. [[Jewish Telegraphic Agency]]. 31 December 2008</ref> "gave the Israeli government until 10 a.m. Thursday to allow a small group of reporters into the Gaza Strip. The court warned that the reporters would be in the embattled area at their own risk".<ref name="jtadec31"/> The ruling "went against a government decision six weeks ago to keep foreign reporters out of Gaza until rockets fired against Israel were halted".<ref name="jtadec31"/>
Ninety-three trucks carrying medicine, medical supplies and food donated by Jordan and international organisations were allowed entry to the Gaza Strip, through the [[Kerem Shalom]] border crossing. The World Food Programme notified the IDF that it was not in need of any further food shipments, as its warehouses were filled to capacity.<ref name=Katz>{{cite web|date=2 January 2009|title='Humanitarian aid flow in our interest'|last=Katz|first=Yaakov|publisher=[[Jerusalem Post]]|url=http://fr.jpost.com/servlet/Satellite?cid=1230733120490&pagename=JPost/JPArticle/ShowFull|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5dWr1UKAR?url=http://www.jpost.com/servlet/Satellite?cid=1230733120490&pagename=JPost%2FJPArticle%2FShowFull|archivedate=2 January 2009|deadurl=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://jta.org/news/article/2008/12/31/1001935/israel-bombs-gaza-mosque-storing-rockets|title=JTA - Jewish & Israel News - Jewish Telegraphic Agency|work=Jewish Telegraphic Agency|accessdate=6 December 2014}}</ref>
Top UN aid officials urged Israel to allow for the resumption of fuel deliveries into the Gaza Strip, noting that the fuel shortage resulting from the suspension of deliveries had caused the main power plant in Gaza to shut down on 30 December, affecting 350,000 people in Central and Northern Gaza, who live with 16 hours or more of powercuts per day.<ref name=Leist/>
The United Nations Security Council met for two hours to hear statements from the Secretary General, the representatives of Palestine, Israel and the other members of the Council.<ref name="UN_SPV6060_2008">{{UN document |docid=S-PV-6060 |date=31 December 2008 |type=Verbatim Report |body=Security Council |meeting=6060 |accessdate=10 January 2009|title=The Situation in the Middle East}}</ref>
===January===
====1 January 2009==== Israeli air strikes hit Gaza's [[Palestinian Legislative Council|parliament building]], and the offices of the [[Education Minister of the Palestinian National Authority|education]] and justice ministries, leaving four dead and 25 wounded.<ref name="AL-Jazeera"/> A pre-dawn strike against the home of a Hamas operative resulted in the death of a Palestinian woman.<ref>[http://abcnews.go.com/International/WireStory?id=6559659&page=3 Israel Demands Monitors] [[ABC News]]. 1 January 2009.</ref> Palestinian reports also mention missiles landed on a workshop and several money changers' offices, one of which was close to a children's hospital, slightly damaging it. In Rafah, air strikes destroyed five smuggling tunnels and a police command center, while in Gaza City, an alleged weapons manufacturing center and storage facility was destroyed.<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/middle_east/7806844.stm Gaza violence goes into sixth day] [[BBC News]]. 1 January 2009.</ref> Dozens of Israelis received text messages from Hamas in the morning warning that the offensive on Gaza would only bring about massive rocket fire on Israel.<ref name=Waked>{{cite web|title=Hamas sends text messages to Israeli cell phones|author=Ali Waked|date=1 January 2009|accessdate=1 January 2009|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-3648799,00.html}}</ref> According to Israeli military sources, Hamas launched more than 50 rockets into Israel without causing casualties.<ref name=AFP>{{cite web|title=Israeli raid kills Hamas leader on 6th day of blitz |url=https://news.yahoo.com/s/afp/20090101/ts_afp/mideastconflictgaza |publisher=[[Yahoo! News]] |date=1 January 2009 |accessdate=3 January 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090101200415/http://news.yahoo.com/s/afp/20090101/ts_afp/mideastconflictgaza |archivedate=1 January 2009 }}</ref> Rockets hit Beersheba and Ashdod, damaging a residential building in the latter city.<ref name="AL-Jazeera">[http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2009/01/2009118156881174.html Israel resumes bombardment of Gaza] [[Al-Jazeera]]. 1 January 2009.</ref>
On 1 January, more than 30 rockets were fired from Gaza into Southern Israel. One of them hit [[Ashdod]], and two hit [[Beersheba]]. On 2 January, Hamas fired more than 20 rockets into Israel, some of them hitting [[Ashkelon]], with 20 more rockets being fired the next day.<ref name="Timeline">{{cite news| url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/middle_east/7812290.stm | work=BBC News | title=Gaza conflict: Timeline | date=18 January 2009}}</ref>
An Israeli warplane dropped a one-ton bomb on the home of [[Nizar Rayan]], a senior Hamas political leader, in the [[Jabaliya]] refugee camp, killing him, 9 women (including his four wives), his 11 children,<ref name=Harel>{{cite web|title=IDF targets senior Hamas figures|author=Haaretz Correspondents and Agencies, Amos Harel and Yoav Stern|url=http://www.haaretz.com/hasen/spages/1052052.html|date=2 January 2009|accessdate=2 January 2009}}</ref> and wounding another 30.<ref name=AP>{{cite web|title=Child casualties mount in besieged Gaza|author=The Associated Press|publisher=International Herald Tribune|date=1 January 2009|url=http://www.iht.com/articles/ap/2009/01/01/news/ML-Gaza-Children-Casualties.php|accessdate=1 2009.</ref><ref>[http://www.cnn.com/2009/WORLD/meast/01/01/israel.gaza/index.html Israelis strike homes of 2 top Hamas figures; at least 1 killed] [[CNN]]. 1 January 2009.</ref> As a liaison between the political and armed wings of Hamas and advocate of renewing [[suicide bombing]]s, Rayan is the most senior political figure to be killed by Israel since =telegraph_rayan>[https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/middleeast/israel/4061004/Hardline-Hamas-leader-killed-in-air-strike-on-Gaza-home.html Hardline Hamas leader killed in air strike on Gaza home] [[The Daily Telegraph|The Telegraph]]. 1 January 2009.</ref><ref name=Ynetreporters/> The ''[[International Herald Tribune]]'' reported that among those killed were Rayan's four wives and nine of their twelve children.<ref name=AP/> On 2 January, the ''[[Times Online]]'' reports instead that two of his four wives and four of his 12 children were killed.<ref name = "Times 5430133">{{cite news | url = http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/world/middle_east/article5430133.ece | publisher = The Times | location = Beersheba, IL | title = Gaza rockets put Israel’s nuclear plant in battle zone | accessdate = 3 January 2009 | date = 2 January 2009 | first = James | last = HIDER}}</ref> [[UN]] [[OCHA]] reports that 13 of his family members, including 11 of his children, were killed and family was warned by the IDF to leave the building but that they had refused to do so.<ref name=telegraph_rayan/><ref name=Ynetreporters/> According to [[ynet]], recent deliberations by the [[Israeli Defence Forces|IDF]] resulted in a decision that striking homes used as weapons storages when sufficient warning is given to the residents falls within the boundaries of [[international law]] and is legitimate.<ref name=Ynetreporters>{{cite web|title=Hamas leader, 20 Palestinians killed in IAF strikes|date=1 January 2009|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-3648848,00.html|accessdate=1 January 2009}}</ref> Rayan had sent his son to carry out a suicide attack in the community of [[Elei Sinai]] in 2001 in which two Israelis were killed, and was behind the bombing in the [[Ashdod]] 2009|publisher=BBC|accessdate=1 January 2009}}</ref><ref name="CT">{{cite news|url=http://www.chicagotribune.com/news/nationworld/la-fg-gaza2-2009jan02,0,6920458.story?track=rss|title=Israeli Missile 2011|df=dmy-all}}</ref><ref name="LAT_rayan">{{cite news|url=http://www.latimes.com/news/nationworld/world/la-fg-gaza2-2009jan02,0,2260601.story|title=Israeli strike kills a top Hamas leader in Gaza|date=1 January 2009|publisher=Los Angeles Times|accessdate=1 January 2009 | first1=Ashraf | last1=Khalil | first2=Ahmed | last2=Burai}}</ref>
Ninety trucks carrying food and medical supplies provided by international organisations entered the Gaza Strip through the [[Kerem Shalom]] border crossing.<ref name="ynetnews_jan1">{{cite web|date=1 January 2009|title=90 aid trucks to enter Gaza|author=[[ynetnews]]|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-3648605,00.html}}</ref> Egypt blocked the entry of humanitarian aid from [[Qatar]] to pass through the Rafah crossing, however, Israel announced it would allow several aircraft from Qatar to land in Israel and the aid will be sent by truck to Gaza.<ref>Ravid, Barak. [http://www.haaretz.com/hasen/spages/1051015.html Israel to allow Qatar to bring in aid to Gaza] [[Haaretz]]. 1 January 2009.</ref>
====2 January 2009==== Hamas called for a "Day of Wrath" against Israel, bringing thousands of protesters out onto the streets of Gaza and the West Bank.<ref>[http://uk.news.yahoo.com/18/20090102/twl-israeli-attack-kills-brothers-as-ham-3cd7efd.html Israeli attack kills brothers as Hamas stages 'Day of Wrath']{{Dead link|date=July 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=no }}, ''Yahoo'', 2 January 2008</ref> Israeli air strikes on Friday targeted the homes of 20 Hamas officials,<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/middle_east/7809154.stm Hamas warns against ground attack] ''[[BBC News]]''. 2 January 2009.</ref> including that of Imad Akel in [[Nuseirat]] and Mohammed Madhoun. One of the strikes in Khan Yunis killed five civilians.<ref>[http://www.cnn.com/2009/WORLD/meast/01/02/israel.gaza/index.html Israel bombs as tanks wait on outskirts of Gaza] ''[[CNN News]]''. 2 January 2009.</ref> Israel began to bomb the ground near its boundary in an attempt to clear it of landmines, increasing speculation that a ground offensive was imminent. Israel briefly opened the Erez crossing to allow about 440 residents with foreign passports to leave the Gaza Strip.<ref>[http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2009/01/200912145020649135.html Gaza mourns as strikes continue] ''[[Al-Jazeera]].'' 2 January 2009.</ref> Foreign journalists continued to be barred entry to Gaza; those who had lined up at the Erez crossing intending to enter after a court decision supported their right to do so when the crossing is open, were turned back by Israeli authorities.<ref name="AP_foreign_reps">{{cite web|title=Israel maintains ban on journalists entering Gaza|author=The Associated Press|publisher=International Herald Tribune|url = http://www.iht.com/articles/ap/2009/01/02/news/ML-Israel-Journalists-Banned.php|date=2 January 2009}}</ref> At around 10:45, in a repeat attack south-west of [[Deir al-Balah]], an [[International Red Cross and Red Crescent Movement]] ambulance, which had arrived to transport survivors following an initial attack, was destroyed by a second Israeli attack. The two crew members in the ambulance were injured and hospitalised.<ref name="maan_redcrescent">{{cite news | pages= | title=Ambulances fired upon, crews and journalists injured | date=2 January 2009 | publisher=[[Palestine News Network]] | url=http://english.pnn.ps/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=4381&Itemid=1 | accessdate=3 January 2009 | archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5dXgbuNC4?url=http://english.pnn.ps/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=4381&Itemid=1 | archivedate=3 January 2009 | deadurl=yes | df=dmy-all }}</ref>
Throughout the day, thirty rockets were fired at Israel; three people were lightly injured, and several buildings sustained heavy damage.<ref name="ynetnews_jan2">{{cite news |title=One injured as rocket hits Ashkelon home | date=2 January 2009 | publisher=[[ynetnews]] | url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-3649292,00.html |accessdate=3 January 2009}}</ref> In [[Jerusalem]], men under the age of 50, or those who didn't hold Israeli ID were unable to access prayers in the [[Al-Aqsa Mosque]].<ref name="ocha_report_1_2" />
====3 January 2009==== Through 3 January 2009, Israel Air Force had flown 555 fighter sorties and 125 helicopter missions. Hundreds of unmanned aerial vehicle ([[UAV]]) flight hours were logged. They claimed to have destroyed more than 500 targets including one-third of the underground passages built by Hamas and other militant groups to smuggle and store rockets, weaponry, and other supplies.<ref name="In Gaza, Both Sides Reveal New Gear">{{cite news| title= In Gaza, Both Sides Reveal New Gear| url= http://www.defensenews.com/story.php?i=3885990| publisher= Defense News| date= 5 January 2009}}{{Dead link|date=July 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=no }}</ref> Throughout the initial stages of the air operation, the IDF transmitted messages to civilians in Gaza to stay away from Kassam launch sites and Hamas buildings and infrastructure.<ref name="JPOST" />
Thirteen Palestinians, including six children, were killed and dozens wounded when the Israeli Air Force bombed the Maqadna Mosque in [[Beit Lahiya]], in which about 200 people had gathered for evening prayers.<ref name = "BBC 7809699">{{cite news | url = http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/middle_east/7809699.stm | title = Israel steps up offensive on Gaza | publisher = BBC News | date = 2 January 2009 | accessdate = 3 January 2009 | location = London, UK}}</ref><ref name="haaretz-groundInvasion"> {{cite web |first = Amos |last = Harel |author2=Yoav Stern |author3=Yanir Yagana |url = http://www.haaretz.com/hasen/spages/1052299.html |title = Israel launches a ground operation in the Gaza Strip |date = 3 January 2009 |accessdate = 3 January 2009|publisher = Haaretz |location = Jerusalem }} </ref> Witnesses said over 200 Palestinians were praying inside at the time.<ref name = "guardian_almaqadna">{{cite news | title = Israel fires artillery shells into Gaza | url= https://www.theguardian.com/world/2009/jan/03/gaza-israel-attacks-artillery | publisher = Guardian | date = 3 January 2009 | location=London | first=Matthew | last=Weaver | accessdate=25 May 2010}}</ref> Another person was killed as the [[American International School in Gaza]] was destroyed.<ref name="bbc_almaqadna">{{cite news | title = World protests at Gaza conflict | url = http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/middle_east/7809676.stm | publisher = BBC News | date = 2 January 2009}}</ref>
A senior commander of Hamas' armed wing, [[Abu Zakaria al-Jamal]] was killed.<ref name=Jan3Ynetnews>{{cite web|title=Hamas commander killed in Gaza strike|date=3 January 2009|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-3649466,00.html|accessdate=3 January 2009}}</ref> He was commander of Gaza City's rocket-launching squads.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2009/WORLD/meast/01/03/israel.gaza/|title=At least 4 Palestinians killed in Israeli ground assault|publisher=|accessdate=6 December 2014}}</ref> In another air strike, Jamal Mamduch, commander of the Gaza City battalion, was killed.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nrg.co.il/online/1/ART1/834/737.html?hp=0&loc=1&tmp=4098|script-title=he:חיה"א חיסל מפקד בגדודי עז א-דין אל-קסאם בעזה|first=Amir|last=Buchbut|publisher=nrgמעריב|language=Hebrew|accessdate=3 January 2009}}</ref> Many of the killed Hamas leaders died along with their families in their own homes.
At least 34 rockets were fired at Israel during the day, damaging several buildings, and lightly injuring one woman in [[Netivot]]. A number of Hamas rockets hit the city of [[Beersheba]] (population 186,000) in southern Israel, with one exploding on an empty school.<ref name=Jpost_jan3>{{cite web|title=Cafeteria hit in early morning volley|publisher=[[Jerusalem Post]]|date=3 January 2009|url=http://fr.jpost.com/servlet/Satellite?cid=1230733150873&pagename=JPost/JPArticle/ShowFull|accessdate=3 January 2009|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120129110301/http://fr.jpost.com/servlet/Satellite?cid=1230733150873&pagename=JPost%2FJPArticle%2FShowFull|archivedate=29 January 2012|df=dmy-all}}</ref> Four Israelis had been killed by rockets fired from Gaza since the beginning of IAF attacks.<ref name="BBC 7809699"/>
Israel launched its first artillery strikes. Israel had at this point carried out more than 700 strikes on Gaza since launching the offensive a week prior, according to [[Agence France-Presse|AFP]].
The UN warned of a worsening humanitarian crisis, and reported that at least 100 of the more than 400 Palestinians killed by Israel at this point were women and children.<ref name="BBC 7809699"/>
On the evening of 3 January, Israeli ground troops entered Gaza.<ref name="haaretz-groundInvasion" /><ref name="ynet_ground_troops_started">{{cite news | url = http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-3649729,00.html | title = IDF enters Gaza; dozens of terrorists hurt | accessdate = 3 January 2009 | date = 3 January 2009 | first = Hanan | last = Greenberg}}</ref> The intention of the ground invasion, according to the Israeli Defense Forces website, was to secure areas within the Gaza Strip from which rockets had been launched after previous Israeli operations.
The United Nations Security Council held another closed-door meeting which failed to produce an official statement or an on-the-record debate or vote on a resolution.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.cnn.com/2009/WORLD/meast/01/03/israel.gaza.diplomacy/?iref=mpstoryview|title=UN Security Council failes to reach Gaza consensus|date=4 January 2009|publisher=CNN}}</ref> Speaking outside the meeting, the [[President of the General Assembly]] [[Miguel d'Escoto Brockmann]] said "Once again, the world is watching in dismay the dysfunctionality of the Security Council."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.undemocracy.com/securitycouncil/webcastindex/2009#d2009-01-03|title=Media Stakeout: Informal comments to the media|date=3 January 2009}}</ref>
====4 January 2009==== Israeli ground troops entered Beit Lahiya and Beit Hanoun in northern Gaza in the early hours.<ref name="aljazeera4jan">[http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2009/01/20091322357629723.html Israeli ground troops enter Gaza], ''Al Jazeera English''. 4 January 2009</ref> Israeli forces bisected Gaza and surrounded [[Gaza City]], but reportedly restricted their movements to areas that were not heavily urbanised.<ref>[http://www.haaretz.com/hasen/spages/1052299.html IDF soldier killed, another seriously wounded in Gaza ground operation], ''Haaretz'', 4 January 2009</ref> The Israeli military said forty sites had been targeted, including targets for weapons depots and rocket launch sites. Despite a Supreme Court ruling to allow a limited number of journalists into the warzone, Israel refused to allow journalists into the area.<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/middle_east/7810270.stm Israel troops clash with Hamas] BBC News</ref> Heavy fighting was reported near [[Gaza City]].<ref name="aljazeera4jan"/> The IDF reported that 30 of its soldiers were wounded, 28 from a single mortar shell which landed next to a Golani regiment, with two out of those 30 badly injured. One later died of his wounds. Israel claimed that at least 50 Hamas fighters were killed in the incursion and dozens more were wounded.<ref>[http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-3650149,00.html IDF deep in Strip: 50 terrorists killed] ''Ynetnews''. [2009-01-04]</ref> The Israeli soldier killed was identified as 22-year-old Sergeant Dvir Emanuelof.<ref name="haaretz_2nd_israeli_soldier_casualty">{{cite web|url=http://www.haaretz.com/hasen/spages/1052299.html|title=Palestinians: Mother, 4 Children Killed in IDF Gaza Offensive|work=Haaretz.com}}</ref><ref>[http://fr.jpost.com/servlet/Satellite?cid=1230733158821&pagename=JPost/JPArticle/ShowFull IDF soldier dies of wounds sustained in Gaza mortar fire] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120111175345/http://fr.jpost.com/servlet/Satellite?cid=1230733158821&pagename=JPost%2FJPArticle%2FShowFull |date=11 January 2012 }}</ref><ref>[http://fr.jpost.com/servlet/Satellite?cid=1230733158821&pagename=JPost/JPArticle/ShowFull IDF cuts Gaza Strip in two as it readies expanded ground operation | Confronting Hamas | Jerusalem Post<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120111175345/http://fr.jpost.com/servlet/Satellite?cid=1230733158821&pagename=JPost%2FJPArticle%2FShowFull |date=11 January 2012 }}</ref> Palestinian medical sources said that at least 21 Palestinians were killed in the fighting.<ref name=CNN4Jan>{{cite news|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2009/WORLD/meast/01/04/israel.gaza/index.html|title=Israeli troops push forward, splitting Gaza|publisher=CNN News | date=4 January 2009 | accessdate=25 May 2010}}</ref> Additionally, Palestinian health ministry officials stated that at least 17 people were killed and 130 injured when Israeli shells fell near a school and the main market in Gaza City. A tank shell fired in northern Gaza killed 12 people, apparently including civilians. An Israeli missile hit a house in the [[Shuja'iyya]] neighborhood, killing a mother and her four children. In the morning, an ambulance operating out of Al-Awda hospital in the northern city of [[Beit Lahiya]] was shelled, seriously injuring 4 medical staff.<ref name="ocha_report_1_4">{{Cite news | title = Situation Report from the Humanitarian Coordinator - 4 January 2009 as of 17:00 | url = http://www.ochaopt.org/gazacrisis/admin/output/files/ocha_opt_gaza_situation_report_2009_01_04_english.pdf | date = 4 January 2009 | publisher = [[UN]] [[Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs]] | accessdate = 4 January 2009 | archiveurl = https://www.webcitation.org/5daA4mm1G?url=http://www.ochaopt.org/gazacrisis/admin/output/files/ocha_opt_gaza_situation_report_2009_01_04_english.pdf | archivedate = 4 January 2009 }}</ref> At least 41 rockets and mortars were fired into Israel.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.jpost.com/Israel/Article.aspx?id=127615 |title=6 hurt as 45 rockets, shells hit South |publisher=The Jerusalem Post |date=4 January 2009 |accessdate=18 November 2012}}</ref> Three Israeli civilians were lightly wounded.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/middle_east/7810270.stm |title=Israeli troops clash with Hamas |publisher=BBC News |date=4 January 2009 |accessdate=18 November 2012}}</ref>
Three senior [[Hamas]] leaders were killed on Sunday: Hussam Hamdan, who according to the [[Israel Defense Forces|IDF]] was responsible for the organisation's [[rocket]] fire and the man behind the firing of [[Grad missiles]] towards the cities of [[Beersheba]] and [[Ofakim]]; Muhammad Hilou, who according to the IDF was responsible for Hamas' special forces in [[Khan Younis]] and for the firing of long-range rockets; and Mohammed Shalpokh, who commanded Hamas forces in Rafah.<ref name=CNN4Jan/><ref>[http://fr.jpost.com/servlet/Satellite?cid=1230733158821&pagename=JPost/JPArticle/ShowFull IAF kills 2 senior Hamas terrorists] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120111175345/http://fr.jpost.com/servlet/Satellite?cid=1230733158821&pagename=JPost%2FJPArticle%2FShowFull |date=11 January 2012 }}</ref><ref name="ynet_2senior_hamas">{{cite news|title=Rockets fired at Ashdod, Ashkelon; top Hamas man killed |publisher=[[YNET]] |date=4 January 2009 |url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-3650161,00.html |accessdate=4 January 2009 }}</ref><ref>[http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/world/middle_east/article5446175.ece?token=null&offset=12&page=2 Israeli troops reach the edge of Gaza City] ''The Times''</ref>
Also on 4 January, the director of Israel's internal security agency, the [[Shin Bet]], told the cabinet that [[Hamas]] leaders both at home and in exile felt that their organisation was facing an "existential threat" and was "willing to reach an agreement" on a ceasefire. However, Foreign Minister [[Tzipi Livni]] said that Israel did not intend to conclude a "diplomatic product" with Hamas. Such a move had been avoided in the past out of fear of legitimising Hamas as a negotiating partner.{{Citation needed|date=January 2009}}
Hamas sources told ''The Jerusalem Post'' that members of [[al-Aqsa Martyrs' Brigades]], the [[Popular Resistance Committees]], [[Islamic Jihad Movement in Palestine|Islamic Jihad]] and the [[Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine]] were participating in the fighting against the IDF, and that they were making use of U.S. and Israeli weapons confiscated from members of [[Fatah]] in the [[2007 Battle of Gaza]].<ref>[http://fr.jpost.com/servlet/Satellite?cid=1230733174237&pagename=JPost/JPArticle/ShowFull Hamas: We're using PA arms to battle IDF] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120224113253/http://fr.jpost.com/servlet/Satellite?cid=1230733174237&pagename=JPost%2FJPArticle%2FShowFull |date=24 February 2012 }}, ''The Jerusalem Post''</ref>
According to medical sources, the total Palestinian death toll for the day was 42, most of them civilians.<ref name=reutersjan5>{{cite news|title=Israel presses on with Gaza attack|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/wtMostRead/idUSLS69391620090105|date=5 January 2009|publisher=Reuters}}</ref>
Fatah officials in Ramallah told The Jerusalem Post that Hamas militiamen had been assaulting many Fatah activists since the beginning of the operation last Saturday. They said at least 75 activists were shot in the legs while others had their hands broken. Meanwhile, sources close to Hamas revealed over the weekend that the movement had "executed" more than 35 Palestinians who were suspected of collaborating with Israel and were being held in various Hamas security installations.<ref>[http://fr.jpost.com/servlet/Satellite?cid=1230733155685&pagename=JPost/JPArticle/ShowFull Hamas moves on Fatah 'collaborators' | Confronting Hamas | Jerusalem Post<!-- Bot generated title -->]{{Dead link|date=July 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=no }}</ref>
The New York Times reported that Israelis fired tank shells into a house in the Tuffah district,<ref name=NYT6JanWarn/> and that early on the 4th, in the crowded Shati refugee camp near the coast, a shell fired from a navy ship hit another house; there were no survivors.<ref name=NYT6JanWarn>{{cite news|title=Warnings Not Enough for Gaza Families|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2009/01/06/world/middleeast/06scene.html?hp|date=5 January 2009 | work=The New York Times | first1=Taghreed | last1=El-Khodary | first2=Isabel | last2=Kershner | accessdate=25 May 2010}}</ref>
=====Zeitoun incident===== ''[[The Daily Telegraph]]'' reported that in the Zeitoun district, early in the morning of 4 January, Israeli troops evacuated about 110 members of the Samouni, an extended family clan, into a Samouni-owned warehouse, where they waited without running water or food for 24 hours. Starting at 6:35am on the 5th, the house was repeatedly shelled. Some were killed inside the building by falling masonry; although the rest attempted to flee the building, the majority of the dead were killed outside, by shrapnel.<ref name=TDT7Jan>{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/middleeast/israel/4162193/Gaza-medics-describe-horror-of-strike-which-killed-70.html|title=Gaza medics describe horror of strike which killed 70|work=Daily Telegraph | location=London | first=Tim | last=Butcher | date=7 January 2009 | accessdate=25 May 2010}}</ref> Initial reports were of 60 to 70 killed;<ref name=TDT7Jan/> the UN count of the total killed was 30, with 11 Samouni family members dead.<ref name=NYT9Jan>{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2009/01/10/world/middleeast/10zeitoun.html|title=30 Confirmed Dead in Shelling of Gaza Family|work=New York Times|date=9 January 2009|accessdate=24 Jan 2009 | first=Alan | last=Cowell}}</ref> A few survivors, some wounded, others carrying some of the dead or dying, managed to reach Gaza's main north-south road where passing cars stopped to take them to the hospital. A [[Red Crescent]] volunteer said that injured people were left behind: "we could not get to them and it was no longer safe for us to stay."<ref name=TDT7Jan/>
